metadata.title: CVE-2017-18190 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A localhost.localdomain whitelist entry in valid_host() inscheduler/client.c in CUPS before 2.2.2 allows remote attackers to executearbitrary IPP commands by sending POST requests to the CUPS daemon inconjunction with DNS rebinding. The localhost.localdomain name is oftenresolved via a DNS server (neither the OS nor the web browser isresponsible for ensuring that localhost.localdomain is 127.0.0.1).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
cups-bsd - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
cups-client - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
cups-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
cups-core-drivers - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
cups-daemon - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
cups-ppdc - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
cups-server-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
libcups2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
libcupscgi1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
libcupsimage2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
libcupsmime1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
libcupsppdc1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-0ubuntu1.9').
